bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: [Congressional Record Volume 166, Number 45 (Monday, March 9, 2020)][House]From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Ms. SCHAKOWSKY:H.R. 6135.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, Clause 3The Congress shall have Power . . . To regulate Commercewith foreign Nations, and among the several States, and withthe Indian Tribes.[Page H1555]

item.title: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Enhancement Act

latestAction.text: Read the second time. Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 523.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

summary.text:
No More Narrow Networks Act of 2020

This bill directs the Department of Health and Human Services to establish quantitative network adequacy standards for health insurance plans offered through health insurance exchanges.

bill.title: No More Narrow Networks Act of 2020

item.title: No More Narrow Networks Act of 2020
To amend the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act to require Exchanges to establish network adequacy standards for qualified health plans.
No More Narrow Networks Act of 2020

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Energy and Commerce.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
